fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40268].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Using the attached CSV file and config file perform: Issues (upper menu) >> Import Issues From CSV.
# Using the same files perform: System >> External System Import >> Import from Comma-separated values (CSV)

*Expected Results:*
# Both issues are imported and the time tracking is the same.

*Actual Results:*
# Time tracking on the issue imported using Import Issues From CSV feature is miscalculated.

*Workaround:*
* If you are admin, use only the External System Import.

*Notes:*
* Please see attachments.
fields.summary: Import Issues from CSV does not calculate Estimated and Remaining time properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40267].
  {panel}

Hi!

If you do frequent releases and want to use Release Notes from JIRA (which is really good method) then it's very annoying to go thru a number of clicks every time I want to copy release notes.

A few suggestions/ideas:
1) make default Release Notes format (text/html) configurable per user / project.
2) make release notes in either format accessible under 2 links. So it would take just one click to see these
3) make release notes available as a tab in a version's view in JIRA.

Thanks for very good software otherwise! You, Atlassian guys, are role models for use at MageFlow!

br,
Sven,
CTO
fields.summary: Make version Release Notes format configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40261].
  {panel}

It seems the difference between Details vs. Exclude Details in the Webhook configuration is drastic. The full detail is quite large, but the basic is not useful at all.

The basic should at least provide a reference to the JIRA issue that triggered the Webhook, and as a bonus, maybe even the event? We're receiving the user that triggered the event already.

This is all I get presently:

{code}
POST ?user_id=david&user_key=david HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Accept: */*
Via: 1.1 localhost (Apache-HttpClient/4.2.1-atlassian-2 (cache))
Content-Length: 7278
Host: localhost:9999
Connection: Keep-Alive
User-Agent: Atlassian HttpClient 0.17.3 / JIRA-6.3.6 (6336) / Default
{code}
fields.summary: Webhook Non-Detailed payload could be more useful
Appointments sent to ticketing lose their details
Bugs created on Agile Plan view are created with a resolved time identical to the created time

Jira very slow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40247].
  {panel}

Page: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+project+specific+security

In the first #1 on the page, the copy: 
"Create a new Permission Scheme (Administration -> Schemes -> Permission Scheme)..." 

Should be: 
Create a new Permission Scheme (Administration -> Issues -> Permission Scheme)


Took me a looooong time to find that functionality because the instructions direct users to a sub-section that does not exist. 

Low priority - just letting you know. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Incorrect copy in security instructions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40245].
  {panel}

As a user I would like to be able to run parsing but "invalid" queries (there is a mistyped / non-visible / deleted issue key, version name, project key ...)  and still obtain "partial" results. 

As this might be a genuine mistake that the user would like to correct (a typo for instance), we should ensure that a visible warning is displayed in the UI explaining that the result set might not be complete and listing out the "invalid" values.

That way the user can opt to either "correct" the query or use the results as they are.

For some use cases, the validation errors don't really matter as the use cases are for instance: "return issues with keys including x,y,z if they exist ..." so the non-existence of one of the issues in the list is not really a problem for the user executing the query. 

Currently, the REST API exposes a {{validateQuery}} param to skip validation. When this issue is implemented, we must ensure that the behaviour of the search REST interface is consistent with the changes done under this issue.
fields.summary: Allow JQL searches via the Issue Navigator to skip validation and return partial results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40243].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Dark feature enabled (com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation)
# Have projects created
# Have agile board for these projects
# Click on Projects (upper menu) >> Project Name

*Expected Results:*
# It's redirected to the Project's page

*Actual Results:*
# It's been redirected to the Agile board of this project

*Workaround:*
# Access the Dark Features Administration screen via direct URL (_<INSTANCE_URL>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_)
# Disable dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Switch}}
# Add dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation.Disabled}}
fields.summary: Project Menu redirects to Agile Board (DarkFeature)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40235].
  {panel}

When JIRA is connecting LDAP using Connector, the Display Name cannot combine 2 or more fields from LDAP. 

Reason of Requirement:
* Display Name value in LDAP does not match the current format
* editing all the user's Display Name value is not feasible

Thus, JIRA should have an option to create a new Display Name based on 2 or more fields
fields.summary: Set User Display Name from multiple LDAP attributes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40228].
  {panel}

If you have a hierarchical/structured naming scheme for labels and components, it would be really nice to be able to define searches that include partial matches. 

i.e. labels ~ "Prefix*"

or even something function based that would be evaluated on the fly:

labels in labelsmatching("Prefix*")
fields.summary: Would like to be able to pattern match/partial search "labels" and "components"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40226].
  {panel}

1- Created custom fields
2- Created new screen and screen scheme
3- Assigned all custom fields to new screen and removed all default fields
4- Assigned the custom screen to my own project.

Now if trying to create an issue , JIRA showing error 

"Summary: You must specify a summary of the issue."

But in actual , Summary field that is default field is not associated with the screen. its in hidden and showing error.
fields.summary: If custom screen is created with custom fields, JIRA showing error for mandatory default fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40220].
  {panel}

*Hello Everyone* :)

You may have noticed that we recently changed the issuetype from "bug" to "suggestion". This does not have anything to do with the importance of the issue.

We are investing heavily in improving performance and slow initial pageloads is one of the focus areas. We've made some progress in the last quarter or two, however, as those of you with performance optimisation experience know, there are many things that contribute to the slow initial pageloads and we need to tackle a laundry list of things in order to make a substantial impact.

In the meantime, if you are experiencing slow initial page loads I'd love to hear more detail on this ticket, *so pls answer a few questions via this google form: [https://goo.gl/gnltna]*

Thanks for your help,
*Otto Ruettinger*
*Principal Product Manager, JIRA*



-----------------------------------
*Original Description*
After JIRA Cloud is restarted, which occurs once a week for the [maintenance window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+maintenance+windows] at a minimum, the very first JIRA page that is loaded can take a very long time to load.

The time can vary depending on network speed, but from Sydney it has taken up to 25 seconds to load the first page on a completely empty instance.

We've also identified that JIRA can take up to 20 seconds to load the dashboard simply if you haven't loaded JIRA for about a day.

The dashboard is the primary page that experiences slowness, however, if you visit any other page first then that page will be the slowest to load.

After the initial page load pages of different types, such as the projects page or issue navigator, may take some time on first load (up to 10 seconds during our testing, but you may experience more slowness) while the css and js are downloaded.

Once everything is cached then pages should be loading at more acceptable speeds (1-4 seconds in our testing).

If you are continuing to experience performance problems once everything is cached please log a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] and provide a [HAR file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Generating+and+Reading+a+HAR+File+For+Performance+Troubleshooting] of your experience.

At this stage theres is no workaround, at least one user will experience slowness after a restart, once the javascript and css files are cached though then JIRA will be significantly more responsive.

Atlassian is aware of the slowness experienced by our JIRA Cloud customers, and improving the responsiveness of our applications is of utmost importance to us.
fields.summary: The first load of a JIRA Cloud page after an hour and a half of being idle takes a very long time
Update the JIRA documentation for the quick create dialog changes to custom field retention
Customizable "Not a Member" Text at Login Screen
2-Factor Authentication

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Add new mail handler
2. name it anything (doesn't matter)
3. use Local Files or any other exiting mailbox (doesn't matter)
4. Pick the "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"
6. add a Regex to the screen
7. edit the mail handler again and change the type to "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue".

h3. Expected results
- Fields like 'Regex' does not apply to the new mail handler

h4. Actual results
- 'Regex' field value is retained
fields.summary: Changing email handler type does not reset existing field values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40183].
  {panel}

Our users bristle at the thought of changing their JIRA password because of the unfriendly nature of the "Reset Password" page (ResetPassword!default.jspa)

This request entails:
# can the reset page discover the password complexity rules
# have those rules be enforced on the page, graying out the "submit" button if a password does not meet those rules

We get so many emails from frustrated users that this enhancement would certainly help alleviate the angst for our JIRA users.

An example of a "happy" user: 
{panel}
The ***** JIRA has literally the worst login & forgot your password flow I've ever encountered. I want to kill someone after using it, it's so shitty. Let me give you just the bare minimum set of features that are broken: 
1) No visibility into why already-working passwords have broken. 
2) The login link sent in a FYP email SAYS it works for 24 hours, but in reality works for exactly ONE try. 
3) The requirements for password strength are ridiculous for an internal tool. Especially when combined with bug #2. 
4) Even after resetting correctly, I can't fucking login. I can cut & paste the EXACT form entry, and it won't work. I can manually type it in, in case there's some ridiculous restriction on cut & pasting, and login credentials are still rejected. 

Please fix this festering pile of crap. If it weren't for the fact that useful data is only available in this bug tracker, I'd never use it again. Luckily for JIRA, it has a captive audience, so I can't leave with my wallet. 
{panel}
fields.summary: Enforce password complexity on the reset password page
Choose an alternate field name fo each configuration context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40177].
  {panel}

Currently we have [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] in our documentation with a thorough explanation with steps on how to use JIRA over SSL.

We also have inside the $JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml file a commented text with 4 steps on how to do that that seems much simpler/faster than the steps in the page.
{quote}
To run JIRA via HTTPS:

             * Uncomment the Connector below
             * Execute:
                 %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA (Windows)
                 $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA  (Unix)
               with a password value of "changeit" for both the certificate and the keystore itself.
             * If you are on JDK1.3 or earlier, download and install JSSE 1.0.2 or later, and put the JAR files into
               "$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/ext"
             * Restart and visit https://localhost:8443/
{quote}

Is there any difference in using the documentation page method or the commented method?
If the method in the server.xml file is somehow not recommended, should we keep it there?
fields.summary: JIRA over SSL configuration documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40170].
  {panel}

||ID||issueid||globalid||title||url||relationship||applicationtype||
|10000|10000|appId=3f6b7c0a-cf76-32ca-a6d2-69c6654322b7&pageId=4423694|Page|http://10.60.5.195:10553/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4423694|mentioned in|com.atlassian.confluence|

However, the data looks not correct as described in [Remote Confluence Examples|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Fields+in+Remote+Issue+Links#FieldsinRemoteIssueLinks-RemoteConfluenceExamples] documentation.

Adding support for DMARC/SPF in outgoing mail configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40166].
  {panel}

My impression of JIRA is that it provides some limitations due to its long history. Therefore one should think about some concepts and how to improve them. 

*Versions*
A version is an attribute, it may last from start to end. At the end it will provide a release note.
On the other hand, during practical work, a version follows a workflow. At the beginning the content of the version has to be defined. Various dates have to be fixe: start of development, efford, end of development, start of testing, end of testing, same for integration and then go to production. So the content of a version is much more, than the current schema is able to solve. 
Why not think about a version as a issue of type Version. It may provide a workflow, users can adopt it to their needs. So the idea of converting an attribute to an issue can provide much more flexibility as provided today. Existing concepts in JIRA would support this idea. There would be also the possibility to decompose a Version with "Development Phase", "Test Phase" to add the timeline required of the corresponding teams. 
I see a simple functionality as precondition: One should be able to define post actions, conditions on sets of transitions. E.g. disable a transition as long there are issues not in step xyz. It should also be possible to transition other issues by post functions. E.g. For go live, I want to transition all solved issues (linked to the version) to the step "Live". 

*Links*
There is no semantic behind links. A link can express specific information, a test case refers to a requirement, also a bug should refer one ore more requirements as justification, otherwise one should create a change request. Also a change request should link to requirements it affects. It should be possible to calculate information based on sets of linked issues. E.g. "Development Phase" recieves an "Estimated Efford" from all linked "Development Tasks". 

*Durable and project issues*
A requirement lives much longer as projects changing the product. So one could distinghuish issues which are descriptive like test plan, test case or requirement. Other issues exist temporarily during phases of a project. These issues may have strong relations, because the project issues change, create or delete the durable issues. This can be understood as issues reflecting the state of the product, which may be changed by several projects in parallel. 

*Realistic Workflow for large environments*
There is a great difference between the workflow of artefacts like issues and the workflow of some kind of tasks in a project. E.g. Since there may be many customers, one would like to separate the issues in customer related projects. The development is controlled by development projects. If the customer raises an issue (bug, new requirement, ...) the overall workflow will require to create one or more development tasks in the corresponding developer project. At the moment I do not see any functionality suporting this level. 

My thoughts may be not concrete enough to start directly an implementation on it. But I want to tell, that I see a lot of gaps in the product.
fields.summary: JIRA generalisation
Disabling the 'Create issue' pop-up window via UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40164].
  {panel}

It seems that JQL editor has a preference on completing project names instead of project keys in JQL queries.

While this was probably seen as a feature that could make the JQL easier to read, in fact is a bug because the change of the JQL to become broken is probably 100x bigger when they are using project names.

Project names could change because the business decides to rename the project, or because the admins decide to improve the project name in order to help users find the projects easier. 

Any change in the project name would break all JQLs that are using it.

If the JQL would use project key this would almost never happen as changing the project key was impossible until recent versions, and even now is not something that would be done easily.

For this reason I do think that JQL editor should favour usage of project keys inside JQL editor instead of project names.
fields.summary: prevent JQL editor from completing project names instead of project keys
Add support for Oracle 12
Add work log queries whole issue history causing performance hit on issues with large change history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40158].
  {panel}

It seems time (estimates and tracking) is not really handled very well across main task and sub tasks. Perhaps I'm just missing some logic here so feel free to enlighten me. 

First: I have tried the fields Progress and ∑ Progress, but "Field 'progress' is not searchable, it is only sortable"

If a main task has been estimated, defining hours on sub-tasks will add hours to the total on main issue. I'd normally expect this to be detailing of that total, meaning hours should be moved to the subtask from main task. 
If all estimates are defined on sub-tasks and someone logs hours on the main task it immediately ends up on my overrun-report (workratio >100). I'd expect the workratio to calculate from the overall progress.
fields.summary: Time tracking handling with sub-tasks
TemporaryIndexProvider is not closing its searcher properly (and leaks file descriptors)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40150].
  {panel}

On JIRA OnDemand, when uploading a custom image for use as the logo on the JIRA installation, the image will appear blurry after uploading.  Look and Feel section of the Admin panel:
https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa

By default the JIRA logo image is 114x60 and the custom image uploaded is auto-resized to 57x30, exactly half the size.  Attached is a screenshot of the difference between the default JIRA logo (left) and a uploaded custom image of an jira logo uploaded as a custom image and auto reduced size (right) for comparison

As a resolution It would be nice to have JIRA OnDemand use higher resolution custom and default images. Or at least match the Default image resolution.
fields.summary: Custom Image uploads are blury

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40141].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a user I would like to be able to create a custom project template aside from what has been pre-created so that I can specify my own default workflow,  default scheme, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution

This feature can be added as an option on create project screen, so user can browse or select the custom template.
fields.summary: Create a Custom Project Template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40139].
  {panel}

I think allowing the new awesome project re-index function to Project Admins would be a great enhancement.

My use-case is:
I have plugins that are configurable by the Project Admins. Some of these plugins will require a re-index to work as expected and today the Project Admins have to email the JIRA Admin requesting this re-index. This is an un-necessary and inefficient step in my opinion.

If this also could be configurable globally whether Project Admins shall be able to do this it would be great!

And if you could maybe even define what projects shall have this possibility it would add even more value! 

Are there any technical reasons for not allowing this?

Cheers,
// Svante
fields.summary: Allow project re-index for Project Admins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40137].
  {panel}

I maintain that the Scheme Tools functionality "doesn't add value for our users". is just wrongI found it very valuable.

We recently embarked on an effort to clean up duplicate Schemes, Workflows, etc. And when I discovered the tools I realized this was going to be a far easier effort than I'd feared. Ironically, Atlassian removed the tools literally a day or two after I started using them.

I understand why the JIRA Classic prototype has been removed. After all, "[removing the duplication to avoid confusion" is what we're trying to do with our Schemes and Workflows. And the Project Management type provides the same functionality, so nothing is lost to the user.

But the Scheme Tools don't duplicate any other functionality and nothing has been provided to replace them. If Atlassian believes these tools don't add value, they are wrong. Customers who don't use them will ignore them. 

Customers who do use them (like me) see that they DO add value. I don't see how the removal benefits anyone, but how it makes things more difficult for some customers is clear. Please make sure that whoever is in charge knows this. If they would care to contact me directly, I'd appreciate it.
fields.summary: Bring back Scheme Tools
JS error on dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40135].
  {panel}

Our customer is running JIRA on Japanese.
In Japanese, text file most popular encoding is Shift-JIS. Because the text file is encoded by Shift-JIS at default on Windows.
When Japanese text file attached to JIRA issue, it displayed on jira  the text file is mojibake. Mojibake reason is different encoding. JIRA's encoding is UTF-8, but Japanese text file is encoded by Shift-JIS.
If JIRA will support the Shift-JIS encoding, Japanese text file will not mojibake. And other Japanese encoding problems will be able to clear, too.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Can JIRA supported Shift-JIS encoding?
Timezone Flag update 'other' link does not work on the user profile page
Non optimal performance of TableLayoutUtilsImpl when a customer has lots of fields
More Advanced Search Options for 'Version Picker (single select)' Custom Field Types
Enable Image attachment in Support Tools Plugin
Documentation for all Atlassian products of skipping major versions when upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40121].
  {panel}

As an user, I do want to be able to remove a filter. At this moment, while you are editing a filter there is no option to remove it.

The only place where you can remove a filter is if you go to the screen with all filters, look for it (if you remember the filter name, as you cannot see the filter SQL body in this listing and to press the cogwheel to access the very well hidden delete option).

In addition to the [ Save ] button for filter we need a [ Delete ] button, that would remove the filter. This should be really easy to implement as it would just require to add some HTML code.

This design bug has additional side effects, is does increase the number of filters because almost nobody is using the too well hidden remove functionality, because is extremely hard to find it.
fields.summary: On filter editing screen there is no option to remove a filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40112].
  {panel}

We need to review the [Choosing a Default Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Choosing+a+Default+Language] document and correct the following:
- There is no screen with the flags for selecting the language anymore.
- Only the languages below are bundled in a clean JIRA installation:
{noformat}
English (UK)
English (United States)
French (France)
German (Germany)
Japanese (Japan)
Spanish (Spain)
{noformat}

The following languages are only provided via plugins, which might not yet be fully translated or available in the latest releases:
Chinese, Czech, Danish, Italian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazilian), Russian and Slovak
fields.summary: The Choosing a Default Language document is outdated.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

I think it would be helpful, to have the project list grouped based on the category. Our project list is in the meantime very long.

Instead

|PROJA001|
|PROJA002|

|PROJB002|

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40099].
  {panel}

When JIRA interface tries to do something via Javascript (AJAX) and cannot reach server, it does not show useful error messages to guide the user.

For example when creating a new issue after pressing  the create button, if the server connection is lost or is not completed before HTTP timeout, the create button becomes available to the user after some time and the user does not get any kind of feedback. The new issue might have been created on the server but the users keeps clicking without knowing that he is creating a new issue each time.

Same thing with session timeouts. When the user opens a create window and does not complete the form before session timeout, the user interface insists on not creating the issue but also giving no warning message.

The user interface should check the connection and give feedback to user when anything bad happens with the network. Even a message saying "The server connection is lost, I don't know what happened to your issue" is better than saying nothing.
fields.summary: Network errors do not show useful messages
CSS Files for CDN Disabled Jira Cloud instances still have references to CloudFront
Typo on 'Create Subtask' dialog
Paginate pages in bulk operation wizard where issues are displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40092].
  {panel}

A third party scan found that the Issue Navigator action is vulnerable to content spoofing, in specific text injection. In this case the content spoofing may be used to perform a phishing attack on users.
How to reproduce:
1. go to https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?filter=whscheck%22%20was%20not%20found%20on%20this%20server.%20WARNING:%20Your%20account%20has%20been%20suspended.%20Contact%20WhiteHat%20immediately%20at%20%22000-000-0000.

2. observe that the filter parameter value is found html encoded below in the error message.
fields.summary: Content Spoofing in the /issues/?filter
Ability to define Multiple Roles at a Component.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40084].
  {panel}

This bug is related to JRA-24633,

h3. Problem Description

When customer upload a JPEG which is large (>100MB), it requires a lot of memory to generate the Thumbnail (e.g. in avatar picker) of the image and the instance crashes with OOME.

It would be better if there is an error message or limit handling when it captures the size of the file and drop the thumbnail generation to ensure the instance is still running. Instead of allowing and later the instance crashes everytime the issue is loaded.
In case of avatar picker JIRA should reject request informing user that image is too big and that smaller image should be used.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Get a huge dimension picture file (Eg, 2988 x 5312) 
# Upload it as an avatar
# High possibility the instance will run into OOME

h3. Expected Result

To have warning telling that image is too big, or alternatively, drop the thumbnail rendering for the file with error message.

h3. Workaround

To use a smaller size image file for avatar
fields.summary: Large Image Files (> 100MB) in avatar picker causing OOME

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40063].
  {panel}

The wadl located at http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/jira-rest-plugin.wadl
contains entries like this:
<ns2:representation element="List of users" status="200" mediaType="application/json">

The "element" attribute contains a value with embedded spaces.

This causes SoapUI 5.0.0 to fail with:
org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.values.XmlValueOutOfRangeException: Invalid QName value: Localname not a valid NCName in 'List of users'

Replacing the values of these offending elements with values that are valid XML element names seems to make SoapUI happy.
fields.summary: WADL element names contain spaces
Feature to restrict the downloading permission of attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40060].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When the user's time zone is different from the server's time zone, the export would show two different time zones.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# In JIRA, set the time zone of the user/instance (either one is fine) to be different from the server's time zone. In my test, my server timezone is GMT+8, and I set JIRA to use GMT-10
# Search for issues in the Issue Navigator
# Export it as an Excel file, and this is the result :
!export.png|thumbnail!
As can be seen, the two areas indicated by the boxes are referring to different times

h3. Behavior we expect to see
Both times are the same

h3. Behavior we are seeing
The times are different. The top part shows the user's timezone in JIRA. The bottom part shows the timezone of the server.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator export shows two different time zones
Allow the ability to bulk edit permissions in Jira Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40054].
  {panel}

When a Zip Entry has no extension, the default Mimetype "text/html" is applied.
Under Windows 7 with Chrome and  Firefox, it causes that the filename is altered with the ".html" extension.
With IE11, the name is unchanged.

If the default MimeType would be set to "text/plain", we would have probably the ".txt" extension added. 

This behavior seems to be due to the mapping Mime/ContentType defined in the Registry (HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Mime\Database\Content Type).

I did some test by changing the "Content-Disposition" but without the wanted result.

But it we apply as default the Mime Type "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" , the filename is not altered (under Windows with GC, FF and IE).
fields.summary: Zip Entries without extension should be downloaded without changing their filename extension

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40041].
  {panel}

For JIRA Upgrades, could we add "testing the upgrade on a staging/development environment" as mandatory for all three upgrade methods?
Currently it seems to be prescribed only for [Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method].

JIRA upgrades are often complex due to plugins, configurations and customisation. Testing the upgrade on a development/staging environment could avoid production downtime and heartburn.

It would be nice to have it added to these upgrade methods as well.
# [Upgrading JIRA Using a Rapid Upgrade Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Using+a+Rapid+Upgrade+Method]
# [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually]
# Also, the master documentation - [Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA]
fields.summary: Mandatory testing of all JIRA upgrade methods with dev/staging environments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40032].
  {panel}

We are using the new Stash transition feature like this:
If a pull request is created that references an issue link, the issue will be transitioned from "In Progress" to "Review". If the reviewer does not approve the pull request, he declines the pull request and JIRA transitions the issue back to "In Progress".

Since an issue can only be assigned to a single user, the assignee can only be set to a reviewer if there is only one. I suggest that you add the following post functions that can only be used if Stash is linked to JIRA:

- Assign to single reviewer (keep assignee for multiple reviewers)
- Assign to pull request creator
- Remove assignee (could be used for multiple reviewer scenarios)
fields.summary: Stash Transitions: Add a post function to assign an issue to the reviewer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40029].
  {panel}

Normally the steps below occur:
# integrate JIRA with Bamboo
# Release a version in JIRA and it will set "with new build" as default as per screenshot
!Release.png|thumbnail!

h4.Suggestions:
Ability to set default preferences to other option. Eg: ability to set "with no build" as the default preference in the entire JIRA instance. This would prevent  unintended build to be created in Bamboo side
fields.summary: Option to have different preferable build when releasing a version
